<a id="PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D"></a>

# PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Provides parameters for [PhysicsServer2D.body_test_motion()](PhysicsServer2D.md#PhysicsServer2D_method_body_test_motion).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

By changing various properties of this object, such as the motion, you can configure the parameters for [PhysicsServer2D.body_test_motion()](PhysicsServer2D.md#PhysicsServer2D_method_body_test_motion).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_collide_separation_ray"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **collide_separation_ray** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_collide_separation_ray)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_collide_separation_ray_enabled**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_collide_separation_ray_enabled**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, shapes of type [PhysicsServer2D.SHAPE_SEPARATION_RAY](PhysicsServer2D.md#PhysicsServer2D_constant_SHAPE_SEPARATION_RAY) are used to detect collisions and can stop the motion. Can be useful when snapping to the ground.

If set to ``false``, shapes of type [PhysicsServer2D.SHAPE_SEPARATION_RAY](PhysicsServer2D.md#PhysicsServer2D_constant_SHAPE_SEPARATION_RAY) are only used for separation when overlapping with other bodies. That's the main use for separation ray shapes.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_exclude_bodies"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Array](Array.md)\[[RID](RID.md)\] **exclude_bodies** = `[]` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_exclude_bodies)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_exclude_bodies**\ (\ value\: [Array](Array.md)\[[RID](RID.md)\]\ )
- [Array](Array.md)\[[RID](RID.md)\] **get_exclude_bodies**\ (\ )

Optional array of body [RID](RID.md) to exclude from collision. Use [CollisionObject2D.get_rid()](CollisionObject2D.md#CollisionObject2D_method_get_rid) to get the [RID](RID.md) associated with a [CollisionObject2D](CollisionObject2D.md)-derived node.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_exclude_objects"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Array](Array.md)\[[int](int.md)\] **exclude_objects** = `[]` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_exclude_objects)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_exclude_objects**\ (\ value\: [Array](Array.md)\[[int](int.md)\]\ )
- [Array](Array.md)\[[int](int.md)\] **get_exclude_objects**\ (\ )

Optional array of object unique instance ID to exclude from collision. See [Object.get_instance_id()](Object.md#Object_method_get_instance_id).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_from"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Transform2D](Transform2D.md) **from** = `Transform2D(1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_from)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_from**\ (\ value\: [Transform2D](Transform2D.md)\ )
- [Transform2D](Transform2D.md) **get_from**\ (\ )

Transform in global space where the motion should start. Usually set to [Node2D.global_transform](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_global_transform) for the current body's transform.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_margin"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **margin** = `0.08` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_margin)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_margin**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_margin**\ (\ )

Increases the size of the shapes involved in the collision detection.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_motion"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **motion** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_motion)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_motion**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_motion**\ (\ )

Motion vector to define the length and direction of the motion to test.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_recovery_as_collision"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **recovery_as_collision** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsTestMotionParameters2D_property_recovery_as_collision)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_recovery_as_collision_enabled**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_recovery_as_collision_enabled**\ (\ )

If set to ``true``, any depenetration from the recovery phase is reported as a collision; this is used e.g. by [CharacterBody2D](CharacterBody2D.md) for improving floor detection during floor snapping.

If set to ``false``, only collisions resulting from the motion are reported, which is generally the desired behavior.
